text:
vscode question!
vscode autocompletes quote characters. But if I type the quote character, then vscode overwrites the auto quote. That’s great!
But if i do the same with a semicolon, then it just adds another semicolon. Is there a way to get semicolons to behave like quotes when typing?

I don’t know of one specifically but I bet there’s an extension for that. Could be a configuration setting as well, (VS Code has a rediculous amount of customization, it’s a good thing but takes a bit to dig through especially for obscure things like semi-colon replacement)
yeah… Google search has not been helpful (probably cause I don’t know what to call it)
